The FO code below attempts to render the words 'Here is a line break' with a forced newline after 'Here'. The HTML equivalent would be 'Here
is a line break' The newline is created with an empty , which seems to be a common technique. This code works fine with 0.20.3 0.20.4... But under 0.20.5rc2 it repeats the whole line twice with no line break after 'Here' - ie Here is a line break Here is a line break. I have replicated this behaviour on two Red Hat systems using this and other (larger) test documents. Here is a line break

BTW inserfing as a
replacement is bad style. *** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of 17472 ***
